titleStmt.title: W. W. Bush to Beriah Magoffin
CWG11258

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Franklin Ky,
25" April 1862,
Gov Beriah Magoffin,
Frankfort Ky,
Dear Sir,

The Judge of our County Court, Petitioned your Excellency not long since, to affer a reward for the apprehension of James Moore, who Murdered, Columbus Perkins last March; Will you be kind enough to inform me, whether or not you have taken any action in the case. I think it quite necessary to affer one in order to excite the vigilence of the people; & afficers -- He has fled this State, & is now in the State of Tennessee, or Supposed to be there -- It was a very cruel & unprovoked case of murder --

Very Respectfully
Your abt Sevrt.
W. W. Bush
County attorney

$250 Reward for Jas Moore
Murder
Issd Apr 29. 1862
